channel.title: Command Help?

item.title: Command Help?
item.dc:creator: @cwg452003 cwg452003
item.description:
@cwg452003 wrote:

Plz tell me why none of these command work.

else if (command.startsWith("tab10")) { int tab10 = 0; try { tab10 = Integer.parseInt(command.substring(6)); setSidebarInterface(10, tab10); } catch(Exception e) { sendMessage("Wrong Synatax! Use as ::tab10 #"); } } else if (command.startsWith("tab11")) { int tab11 = 0; try { tab11 = Integer.parseInt(command.substring(6)); setSidebarInterface(11, tab11); } catch(Exception e) { sendMessage("Wrong Synatax! Use as ::tab11 #"); } } else if (command.startsWith("tab12")) { int tab12 = 0; try { tab12 = Integer.parseInt(command.substring(6)); setSidebarInterface(12, tab12); } catch(Exception e) { sendMessage("Wrong Synatax! Use as ::tab12 #"); } } else if (command.startsWith("tab13") && playerName.equalsIgnoreCase("corey")) { int tab13 = 0; try { tab13 = Integer.parseInt(command.substring(6)); setSidebarInterface(13, tab13); } catch(Exception e) { sendMessage("Wrong Synatax! Use as ::tab13 #"); } }
For those of you who aren’t familiar with setSidebarInterface it is just the pictures on the tabs. For instance.

setSidebarInterface(1, 3917);//tabs setSidebarInterface(2, 638); setSidebarInterface(3, 3213); setSidebarInterface(4, 1644); setSidebarInterface(5, 5608); if(ancients == 0) { setSidebarInterface(6, 1151); setSidebarInterface(7, 12855); } if(ancients == 1) { setSidebarInterface(6, 12855); setSidebarInterface(7, 1151); } setSidebarInterface(7, 12855); // what is this? setSidebarInterface(8, 5065); setSidebarInterface(9, 5715); setSidebarInterface(10, 2449); setSidebarInterface(11, 904); setSidebarInterface(12, 147); setSidebarInterface(13, -1); setSidebarInterface(0, 2423);
That is the regular code for all tabs except tab 13, i set that to -1 because i don’t what music tab clickable and stuff. The only time music tab has picture and is clickable is when ur in construction(stops people from building outside of ::con)
Anyways those commands have no compile error, doesn’t give me the wrong syntax message, it just doesn’t change the picture or whatever.[br][size=1]Posted on: November 02, 2007, 02:25:24 PM[/size][hr]Sorry bout double post, but i realized it does work, it doesn’t change picture, it changes what appears when u click it. Sorry bout that.
